summary: Methylthioninium chloride, or methylene blue, is a medicine and dye. It treats methemoglobinemia by changing the iron in hemoglobin. It's given by injection and may cause headache or vomiting. Use during pregnancy might be risky, but not using it in methemoglobinemia is worse. First made in 1876, it's on the WHO's essential medicines list.
title: Methylene blue
